Package adsouza.shapes

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • adsouza.shapes.Shape
      • adsouza.shapes.Line
  • public class Line
extends Shape
    This class represents a simple Line. It can draw an instance of a Line using two points and perform various calculations that reflect the attributes of Lines
    Version:
    10/10/2018
    Author:
    D'Souza

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(double x1,
            double y1,
            double x2,
            double y2)
        Creates a custom Line object with two specified coordinates
        Parameters:
        x1 - is the x-coordinate of the first point of the Line
        y1 - is the y-coordinate of the first point of the Line
        x2 - is the x-coordinate of the second point of the Line
        y2 - is the y-coordinate of the second point of the Line

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects​(Line l2)
        Checks whether two Lines intersect each other
        Parameters:
        l2 - is the other line that will be checked for intersection
        Returns:
        returns true if the two lines intersect or false otherwise

      • setPoint2

        public void setPoint2​(double x2,
                      double y2)
        Sets the second coordinate of the Line to (x2, y2)
        Parameters:
        x2 - is the x-coordinate that will be the new second point of the Line
        y2 - is the y-coordinate that will be the new second coordinate of the Line

      • isPointInside

        public boolean isPointInside​(double x,
                             double y)
        Calculates and checks whether the point (x,y) is inside this Shape
        Specified by:
        isPointInside in class Shape
        Parameters:

        y - The y-coordinate of the point to check for inclusion
        Returns:
        True is the the point (x,y) is inside the Line or False otherwise
